title: BREAKING |TM Krishna Shall Not Be Recognized As Recipient Of Sangita Kalanidhi MS Subbulakshmi Award :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Halts Recognition of TM Krishna for Sangita Kalanidhi Award

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court issued an interim order preventing Carnatic musician TM Krishna from being recognized as the recipient of the Sangita Kalanidhi MS Subbulakshmi award, following a petition from the awardee's descendants.

  • The Supreme Court's interim order came after a petition challenged the earlier decision by the Madras High Court to grant the award to TM Krishna.
  • The order stops Krishna from presenting himself as the award recipient.
  • The court emphasized respect for the legacy of MS Subbulakshmi and suggested that TM Krishna’s previous comments might not befit the honor associated with her name.
  • Amidst arguments, it was asserted that awarding the prize to Krishna would tarnish the reputation of the award and its historical significance.
Justice Bhatti stated, "Till we are clear, awardee cannot have the award in the name of person who he is stated to have disrespected."

This case highlights ongoing tensions around cultural representations and respect for artistic legacies.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts Recognition of TM Krishna for Sangita Kalanidhi Award

title: 'Pushpa 2' tops list of second weekend highest grossing movies with Rs 100 crore just in Hindi; followed by 'Stree 2', 'Gadar 2', 'Animal' and 'Baahubali 2' - TOI Etimes
summary:
'Pushpa 2' Breaks Box Office Records in Second Weekend Grossing Rs 100 Crore in Hindi

Publication Date: December 5, 2023
Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2' is making headlines as it sets a new record at the box office, grossing Rs 100 crore in its second weekend from the Hindi version alone, amidst controversies surrounding its lead actor.

  • 'Pushpa 2' grossed Rs 63.3 crore on Saturday, showing a growth of around 73% from Friday.
  • On Sunday, it made Rs 76 crore, with Rs 54 crore coming from the Hindi version.
  • The film is projected to cross Rs 1000 crore net in India across all languages.
  • Other top contenders in the second weekend include 'Stree 2' with Rs 93 crore, 'Gadar 2' with Rs 89 crore, and 'Animal' with Rs 88 crore.
'Pushpa 2' now tops the list of the highest-grossing second weekend movies.

The success of 'Pushpa 2' highlights its popularity and the strong connection it has established with the audience.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Breaks Box Office Records in Second Weekend Grossing Rs 100 Crore in Hindi

title: "Write Panjab Or Punjab...": Diljit Dosanjh Reacts To Spelling Controversy - NDTV
summary:
'Write Panjab Or Punjab...': Diljit Dosanjh Reacts To Spelling Controversy

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A social media post by Punjabi singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh has sparked a 'Punjab vs Panjab' debate after he shared a video captioned with 'Panjab', leading to allegations about his loyalty.

  • Diljit shared a video upon arriving at Chandigarh airport, using the term 'Panjab'.
  • Social media users suggested he was promoting a Pakistani identity by this spelling.
  • In response, Diljit called the accusations 'conspiracy theories'.
  • He emphasized that spelling differences do not affect Punjab's identity.
“If Punjab is written as Panjab, it's called a conspiracy... Whether you write it as Panjab or Punjab... it will always remain Punjab.” — DILJIT DOSANJH

The debate reflects deeper historical and cultural tensions between India and Pakistan regarding the Punjab region's identity.
newTitle: 'Write Panjab Or Punjab...': Diljit Dosanjh Reacts To Spelling Controversy

title: Atlee schools Kapil Sharma for trolling his looks, asks him not to make fun of Archana Puran Singh: ‘Judge by heart, not appearance’ - The Indian Express
summary:

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

During a recent episode of The Great Indian Kapil Show, comedian Kapil Sharma made a joke regarding Atlee Kumar's appearance, which prompted the director to respond thoughtfully about judging others by their character rather than their looks.

  • Kapil Sharma teased Atlee about his looks during the show.
  • Atlee responded by emphasizing that success is based on talent, not appearance.
  • He mentioned being grateful to AR Murugadoss for recognizing his potential based on his work rather than his looks.
  • Atlee defended Archana Puran Singh, calling her the 'saviour' of the show and asked Kapil not to make fun of her.
  • The episode has gone viral, with many criticizing Kapil's remarks.
  • Atlee is currently co-producing Baby John, an adaptation of his film Theri, set to release on December 25.

newTitle: Atlee Schools Kapil Sharma on Judging by Character, Not Appearance

title: Rekha opens up on her one-sided love for Amitabh Bachchan on Netflix's 'The Great Indian Kapil Show,' netizens say 'Her husband loved her deeply but…' - Firstpost
Diljit Dosanjh announces he won't do shows in India until this happens - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh won't perform in India until concert infrastructure improves

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent announcement during his Chandigarh concert, singer Diljit Dosanjh revealed that he will not hold concerts in India until the country's concert infrastructure is properly developed.

  • Diljit made the announcement during a show in Chandigarh on December 14, 2024.
  • He emphasized the lack of infrastructure for live shows, which he sees as a significant source of revenue and employment.
  • During the concert, he dedicated his performance to India's FIDE World Champion, Gukesh Dommaraju.
  • Prior to the show, an advisory from the Chandigarh Commission for Protection of Child Rights urged Diljit to avoid alcohol-themed songs.
  • His upcoming show in Guwahati on December 29 will conclude his tour in India.
“Here we don't have infrastructure for live shows. This is a source of big revenue, many people get work and are able to work here...I'll try next time that the stage is at the centre so that you can be around it. Till this happens, I won't do shows in India, that's for sure.”

Until improvements are made, Diljit remains firm on his decision not to perform in India, illustrating the need for better concert facilities to enhance the live music experience.
newTitle: Diljit Dosanjh won't perform in India until concert infrastructure improves

Zakir Hussain: Legendary tabla player dies at 73 - BBC.com
summary:
Zakir Hussain: Legendary Tabla Player Dies at 73

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: News Agency

Zakir Hussain, one of the world's greatest tabla players, has died at the age of 73 due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  • Hussain was a four-time Grammy award winner and received the Padma Vibhushan.
  • He transformed the tabla into a globally loved solo instrument.
  • Tributes have started pouring in following his death.
  • Nayan Ghosh described him as a pathbreaker and an icon who elevated tabla on the world stage.
“He was a pathbreaker, a game-changer, an icon who put tabla and Indian music on the world map...” - Nayan Ghosh

This legendary musician, born in Mumbai in 1951, has left an indelible mark on classical music.
newTitle: Zakir Hussain: Legendary Tabla Player Dies at 73

title: Ustad Zakir Hussain tribute: Tabla loses its vibrant voice - The Hindu
summary:
Ustad Zakir Hussain tribute: Tabla loses its vibrant voice

Published Date & Source: December 16, 2024

The tabla fell silent as Ustad Zakir Hussain, one of the greatest ambassadors of Indian classical music, passed away on December 16, 2024, after a brief illness in San Francisco, California. He transformed the modest tabla into a voice for universal peace and humanity.

  • Hussain was renowned for his speed, dexterity, and creativity, mesmerizing audiences worldwide.
  • He played a crucial role in popularizing the tabla on a global scale.
  • A child prodigy, he gave his first professional performance at the age of 12.
  • Among his notable achievements are three Grammy Awards received in one night.
  • Hussain blended musical traditions, collaborating with artists across various genres and cultures.
  • He was also an actor, famously appearing in commercials that brought classical music into mainstream culture.
“I haven’t played good enough to quit.”

Ustad Zakir Hussain’s legacy will continue to inspire future generations of musicians and audiences as a testament to the power of music.
newTitle: Ustad Zakir Hussain Tribute: A Legacy in Tabla Music

summary:

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Telugu actor Allu Arjun expresses deep concern for Sri Tej, a boy critically injured in a stampede at a Hyderabad theater screening of 'Pushpa 2'. Following backlash for celebrating his bail, Arjun emphasizes his support for the boy and his family during this difficult time.

  • On December 4, a stampede occurred when Allu Arjun made an unscheduled visit to a theater showing 'Pushpa 2'.
  • Tragically, a woman died and her son, Sri Tej, suffered critical injuries during the incident.
  • Allu Arjun cannot visit the boy due to ongoing legal proceedings but expressed his prayers and commitment to assist with medical and family needs.
  • His previous social media celebrations after being granted bail faced backlash online.
  • Sri Tej is currently receiving medical care and is in stable but serious condition.
“I remain deeply concerned about young Sri Tej, who is under constant medical care after the unfortunate incident. My prayers remain with them and I remain committed to taking responsibility for addressing the medical and family needs.” - Allu Arjun

The incident raises questions about crowd management and responsibilities of celebrities during public appearances, highlighting the need for better safety protocols at events.

title: Cops Reveal Why Kidnappers Did Not Go After Actor Shakti Kapoor - NDTV
summary:

Source: NDTV

The police have arrested four individuals involved in a kidnapping plot that targeted actor Mushtaq Khan, who was taken hostage after being invited to an event. They initially planned to kidnap veteran actor Shakti Kapoor but their plans fell through due to financial disputes.

  • Four gang members arrested in connection to actor Mushtaq Khan's kidnapping at Delhi airport.
  • Gang planned to kidnap Shakti Kapoor under the pretext of inviting him to an event.
  • Mushtaq Khan was kidnapped and held for ransom; his bank details were obtained by the kidnappers.
  • The gang sought ₹ 5 lakh to make the kidnapping of Shakti Kapoor happen, but their plan fell through.
  • Police traced the gang's operations and are seeking to identify other potential victims.
“The gang was involved in kidnapping film stars by sending advance payments and air tickets under the guise of event invitations.”

summary:

summary:

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Unspecified News Source

Zakir Hussain, the celebrated tabla maestro, passed away due to complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. He is mourned by his family and music lovers worldwide.

  • Zakir Hussain died in a San Francisco hospital at the age of 73.
  • He was known as the greatest tabla player of his time, leaving behind a rich legacy.
  • Hussain had been hospitalized for two weeks prior to his death.
  • His collaborations with both Indian and international artists significantly influenced the world of music.
  • Hussain received multiple prestigious awards, including four Grammy Awards and several Padma honors.
  • Messages of condolence and tributes highlighted his humility and immense contributions to music.
“He leaves behind an extraordinary legacy cherished by countless music lovers around the globe.”

Hussain's impact on both Indian classical music and Western music through innovative collaborations is celebrated, with his influence expected to resonate for generations.
newTitle: Tributes Pour In As Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Passes Away At 73

title: Horoscope Today, December 16, 2024: Check here Astrological prediction for all zodiac signs - India Today
Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain dies at 73 - The Hindu
summary:
Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Passes Away at 73

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: The Hindu

Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has passed away at the age of 73 due to complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  • He was hospitalized for the last two weeks before being moved to the ICU.
  • Hussain was a four-time Grammy Award winner, with three awards received at the 66th Grammy Awards earlier in 2024.
  • His career spanned six decades, collaborating with many renowned artists and blending Indian classical music with jazz.
  • He was awarded the Padma Shri in 1988, Padma Bhushan in 2002, and Padma Vibhushan in 2023.
“He defined the sound of the tabla and brought it into the international music scene.”

The passing of Zakir Hussain marks a significant loss for music lovers and the cultural landscape of India.
newTitle: Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Passes Away at 73
